Reviews.Title: “Far away but good price”
Reviews.Author: SLK_Student
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit out of the way of everything that you want to do. Luckily there is a tram stop about 10feet from the enterance but it is a bit of a hastle. The place itself is nice and pretty clean. The staff are really friendly and very helpful. We had to cancel 2 of our days last minute and they had no problem helping us out and refunding what money they could. The rooms are a bit small but nothing too uncomfortable. The common room is big enough with free computers and tv. There is a kitchen which is a bonus but it's kind of messy (but that may have just been from the other people staying there). The free breakfast is just toast with a choice of spreads but it's cheap and tides you over. The other weird thing (but not weird for Amsterdam just weird if you're from the west) is that the bathroom in your room has a shower and a sink (no shower door the sink is literally in the shower) and the toilet is out in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “great hostel”
Reviews.Author: brooke i
Reviews.Content: me and 2 other friends stayed at this hostel in october 2011. hostel was clean, had computers for free access, decent continetal breakfast in the morning, and it was cheap! would stay again. although its not in the city centre, there is a bike shop though were you can hire then about a 40 second walk away!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap as chips”
Reviews.Author: ALaunonen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 10-bed dorms for two nights at the end of our trip to Europe. For 10euros/bed our expectations weren't high, but it wasn't too bad after all. If anything, smelly and lazy young "job-hunters" (read weed smokers) were more of an annoyance than the hostel itself. For this price I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Fairly Priced for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: allybug1990
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on myself and my boyfriends month long interrail trip, and after some of the terrible hostels we stayed in this was a nice surprise. We stayed in a double room (with bunk beds unfortunately) which was well equipped. The room had satellite television, a shared balcony and an "en suite bathroom." The bathroom was the only let down as there was no ventilation at all - and after a few days of staying in the room it began to smell quite a lot and become a bit uncomfortable. It is slightly out of the centre which might be inconvenient to some but was actually quite nice for us after a noisy night in a hostel on ones of Amsterdam's main streets. There is a tram stop right outside the hostel makes it so easy to travel to tourist spots. Overall, we really did enjoy it, there was a nice atmosphere and the people on reception were lovely. If there had been a fan in the bathroom i would have rated it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Grottesco”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaC19
Reviews.Content: We were a group of four people so we booked a room for 4 with private bathroom. The first night we were in something that can't be really called a room. I think it was smaller than imagination can think, 2 bunk beds one almost over the other one and the room was over. Then there was a little bathroom. This room didn't even have a window so you could not even change or GET some air. It was right in front of the reception and upon the bar, so it was very very noisy. The nex morning we asked for another room, so we got one which was a bit bigger, A BIT, but at least we had the window. We paid 60 euros per night for such rooms. Breakfast was included, and it was another funny part of the story...It was basically few slides of bread and some cheese. The guys working there were nice and helpful, but the place is REALLY not worth the money, and not very clean. There were no rats at least, which seems to be a problem in Amsterdam. The position was ok, but really, it was unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even bother.”
Reviews.Author: JessyH
Reviews.Content: What an awful hotel owner, he talked absolute rubbish when he said we were emailed two weeks ago about our booking being cancelled.... Well we received no such email! After of of my friends being pretty upset about it we asked him to sort it out for us but he told us it wasn't his problem.... So if it wasn't for the luck of a friends brother letting us stay at his we would have been thrown out on the streets with no further help. I wouldn't even consider staying there now.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO”
Reviews.Author: mmmmm91
Reviews.Content: On arrival to the hotel my friends and I were informed (after half an hour of waiting in a very tiny room) that our rooms had been cancelled and that we had been emailed 2 weeks prier to traveling, we had not. The man on the door was extremely rude, inappropriate and aggressive and after talking to him for 2 minutes we all agreed that we would have regretted giving him any of our money to stay in such a pokey and unwelcoming hotel. Would not recommend the place to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “felt unsafe in the park”
Reviews.Author: 255100John
Reviews.Content: had a good time in amsterdam with some friends the hotel was not very close by the city centre but a taxi or tram are good options for this problem. we had some problems in the park with another group what ended up in a fight. i thought the park was very unsafe to be in, in the night. expeccially don't go there if you whant to keep your wallot. overall the hotel is worth the money if you can make a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Sikimong
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in single room. The location of the hotel is far from the city center, but easily reachable by taking the tram no. 25 from the AMS Central, which also passes the city center. Since I don't like to stay in the crowd area, it suited me well. The surrounding area is quite quiet but safe. The owners (sorry, I didn't have a chance to ask their names) were nice and helpful. Breakfast was good. Upon checked-in, I was informed that they had just replaced the TV in the room assigned for me, so it did not work for that night. I didn't come to AMS to watch TV, so I didn't mind. It's good that they informed me in advance and asked whether I wanted to choose another room near the reception area, which I refused. The only shortcoming I felt was lack of bathroom amenities. They only provided one sachet of gel both for body and hair. It's not enough. A little bit expensive, but almost all hotels in AMS are expensive, compare with what we get.

Reviews.Title: “Very small. Clean. A bit far from city centre. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: WillyDIreland1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of lads for a stag. It suited us fine but I wouldn't recommend it to a couple or someone looking for a relaxing break. The rooms are the smallest Ive ever seen. It the tv falls off the wall your a goner. The large LCD telly takes up most of the wall. Staff are friendly. The breakfast is adequate. I wouldn't like to be infirm in any way as the stairs are very narrow and steep. The sound insulation from the street outside is very bad. 150 euro for 2 nights is a joke for what ya get though. Spend the bit extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Small and quite far away from Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: laura_pav09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend and my two sisters. The hotel is surrounded by shops/bars and restaurants. There is a lovely park directly over the road from the hotel called Sarphati Park, lots of waterfalls and wildlife. The tram from Central station takes around 10/15 mins and stops directly outside the hotel (tram 25 if helpful), the trams come every 15 minutes to dam square which only takes 10 minutes. The hotel itself was fine, not great if your on the top floor with the amount of steep staires you have to climb up, but the rooms were clean and tidy. Breakfast was a mixture of bread and jams, muesli, fruit and a few hard boiled eggs. Fresh fruit juice and tea and coffee were available too. I will not be staying here again, but only because of location. I would recommend paying a bit extra to stay more near to Central station/Dam square. If your a budjet traveller or travelling as a group this hotel will be fine for you! :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: pearLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sarphatihotel Amsterdam, we had a fantastic stay; a large family room, plenty of space, every day when we came back to the hotel the room was clean and tidy with clean towels. Very helpful staff. Breakfast was delicious; the children loved it! Free coffee, tea and fresh fruit all day. Free wireless internet! Location was great; all the important things like museums, restaurants were closeby, the tramstop is right in front of the hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “recommended! very helpful and friendly staff, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenmel1986
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a short romantic break in June. We are in our early-mid twenties and wanted somewhere close enough to walk to the main city attractions but also somewhere not so in the middle of it all, and for this the location is great. We were greeted by a gentleman who I think was the owner, he was always available and went out of his way to help us and advise us on where to go, prices etc. The rooms are lovely, very well presented and clean. The breakfast was nice in the mornings, continental. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kvitochka
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad. Very small, not far from the city center and easily accessible by trams. Friendly staff, good breakfast. Also you may enjoy coffee, tea and other drinks as well as fruit during the day. WiFi Internet access free of charge. The minus of the hotel is the size of the room: I haven't seen anything smaller than that! But I think this is the problem of the whole city :) Also stairs are very steep (but it was even interesting for me, not so funny for older people and small children I think)

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Paiam
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights . The location is not centre but reachable by trams, the journey from central station is about 15-20 minutes . i'd booked for a single and i found a very small room next to the reception with a separate bathroom. So to reach the bathroom i was forced to go out of the room and go to other part of the corridor !!! When i asked to chenge the room they told me no other rooms were available for that night ! the hotel was noisy, LIVE CHILD SCREAMS from other rooms ! The cleanliness was not bad but not Wow ! the second room i received for the second night was normal with a very small bathroom. The breakfast is normal , enough but nothing special . The staff were polite. So ... for my experience and from other hotels i;ve seen in my trips , sorry but i don't suggest this hotel. I should say that there are not too many economical hotels in Amsterdam and the room are average expensive but i think you can find something better and maybe closer to the center.

Reviews.Title: “shocking!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1320ta
Reviews.Content: dont ever book this hotel,customer service is a joke and so is the firm i booked with(easy to book ha ha)

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel Avoid like the plagued”
Reviews.Author: aakitoye
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for Queens day because everything else was already full which says a lot. The receptionist was not particularly friendly just fairly nonchalent. We wee give a room on the top floor. Unfortunately the hotel has no lift and samll stairs so it is a struggle. The room was awful, vey dated and unwelcoming but worst of all there was a leak in the toilet which was fllodig the bathroom. When we complained the managment said it wasn't that bad and did nothing to fix it. We continued to complain in the morning and were given a slightly better room with a working toilet (once they realised my partner was Dutch.) All in all a crap hotel with a crap attitude, avoid like the plague for the same cost you can book a really decent hotel. This was a joke and gives Amsterdam a very bad name when in fact it's a great city with great people.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ldaoh
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Amsterdam with my 9-year-old grandson. I booked 2 nights at the Sarphati Hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. On the first day we arrrived at the hotel early and asked if we could leave our cases. We then went to the zoo and arrived back at the hotel late afternoon. When they went to book us in we were told our room had been double booked and we couldn't stay there The owner then told us there was a room available at another hotel they were associated with and arranged for a taxi to take us there. This hotel was not the place I would have chosen to stay in, nor was the area but by then I had no choice but stay. This was a 2 star hotel and while the room was clean and the owner was helpful and friendly it was more the kind of place for younger single people or backpackers. I certainly would not recommend the Sarphati to anyone after my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Awful attitude to the guests,extra costs!”
Reviews.Author: pag0pag0
Reviews.Content: It could be OK unless they gave us for the 1st night a single room ( the smallest I've ever seen ) instead of a double that we booked and charged us the same price. One month later they charged me with 100 Euro extra cost without any explanations. Unfortunately I realised it too late to have the money back by my bank and when I tried to write them I haven't even got any response.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: mar5hl
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with this hotel! We found the owner and staff were very friendly, helpful and always nearby, and the hotel was immaculately clean. Breakfast was 'continental', and although we were advised it would be served between 8 and 10 A.M, we were able to still have breakfast when we woke up late at 11. The dining room was open until 11P.M and the owner, Bill, told us to help ourselves to fresh fruit, juice and coffee throughout the day. We stayed in the basement room, which was perfect for us since we both smoke and were able to climb through the window into the pretty patio area, and have a seat. We had a wander about the other floors and into some of the rooms and can honestly say they were all very well kept. Although some rooms were small, most have a balcony. The hotel is near some lovely bars and restaurants (be sure to check out the Duval restaurant!) and the tram stop is pretty much right outside the door. In summary, the Sarphati Hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “we are satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: raven0ch
Reviews.Content: Swissphil family from switzerland. 5-8.Okt.2008 Room 14/quad rm.Young couple with 2kids(12/3) As far my budget was concerned,we had a good hotel to stay for 3nights. Small tidy rooms with fresh towels and bed sheets and steep stairsway,small bathroom still we had a good sleep and breakfast.Friendly and very helpful staff. Tram 25 just infront of the hotel in 15 mins drive we are in dam square and from there we walk,shop and dine around the city. We had fun.....and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Tennesseetraveler62
Reviews.Content: My husand and I stayed at the Sarphati Hotel in July 2008 for almost two weeks. The hotel is in a great location. The #25 tram (which will take you from the hotel to the train station in a few minutes) runs right in front of the hotel and makes it a great beginning point for day trips to the small towns (Utrecht, Leiden, Delft, Haarlem, etc.). Also, it is within walking distance to the museums (must see) and the canal boat tours (a great private canal tour can be arranged by Max at maxman@tiscali.nl - it was the romantic highlight of our trip!). There is a wonderful resturant down the street, Puyck, where we ate several times and loved each dish. The street market is only two blocks away and open M-Sat. I felt safe walking around in the neighborhood by myself and there are lots of shops for browsing. I do recommend that if you plan to send post cards to the US, buy some stamps at the airport before you get to the cusoms area. I found most shops had stamps for EU mail, but not for US mail. Also, make sure that your elctric convertor/adaptor has a round end (not like the ones sold in most electrical stores in the US). As for the hotel, we stayed on the top floor, which meant climbing up the stairs. However, think of it as a your personal stairmaster and a good way to work off the wonderful food you will eat while in the Netherlands. The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were always supplied. Though not large by US standards, it is by European standards. The room was very comfortable and had the ammenities posted on the website (hairdryer, tv, etc.). In the mornings, the breakfast was plenty (breads, cereal, cheese, meat, boiled eggs, juice, and fresh fruit). The staff were very friendly and made sure that our questions were answered and helped out in any way they could. They do provide a keycard for night access through a side door after hours. This was a nice convenience for those late nights. Overall, it was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Money!”
Reviews.Author: Manamana
Reviews.Content: I searched for a long time to find a hotel in Amsterdam that suited our budget and had excellent reviews. This one certainly fitted the bill on paper. The hotel is in an excellent location and is situated opposite Sarphati Park which is lovely and makes for a good view from your window. It's also within walking distance of the daily markets, museums and myriad of restaurants. The Greek restaurant just along the road is great, no frills, just good traditional greek cooking at very reasonable prices. The rooms were spotless with clean sheets and towels. The bathrooms are small but they are clean and have everything you need. The owner is very friendly and gave us loads of advice, telling us where all the best places were and how to get there. The number 25 tram runs from central station and stops right outside the hotel which is superb! The breakfast was excellent and all in all, our stay was far better than we expected. Only thing to look out for is the stairs, never seen such steep stairs in all my life! but apparently that is common in Amsterdam. Makes for an interesting challenge when you've had a few beers etc! : 0 )

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reedme01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for great value then book here. Very clean, good breakfast, great location , comfy beds, clean bedding and fresh towels every day & the owner (William) bends over backwards to ensure your every need is catered for. Would visit again and I highly recommend. A1 for service *******

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: ramblegal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sarphati for 5 nights in September with my husband, delighted by the helpful staff, the room (22), breakfast, and the neighborhood. Rooms are fresh and clean, decor a bit funky, and since we were in the back, we had a view over the gardens. Breakfast included all sorts of breads, a few cheeses and meat, as well as granola and hard boiled eggs. Coffee/tea available all day. And the last day, when I got soaked in a downpour before having to head to the train station, the staff let me into an empty room to dry my hair. Only downside was a bit of a "canal" smell in the tiny bathroom, but it really didn't impact our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaxi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful, the location is excellent- great area out of the city but close enough to walk. It is also right outside the tram stop 25 so easy to find. The park is really beautiful, we sat one afternoon and just watched the people. The breakfast is delicious and the staff don't mind if you are a bit late (unlike big hotels!). The only downfalls were that the stairs are exytremely steep so hard to navigate if you are not fit or had a few too many!!! The other thing that was really bad was that there was a disgusting odour coming out of the bathroom, it really was terrible - i do not recommend room 33!! Otherwise good hotel, we would possibly stay there again depending on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fatter48
Reviews.Content: When we were in Amsterdam, we stayed at Sarphati hotel. This was an excellent choice; it is a very good hotel situated in a friendly neighbourhood, with lots of shops, restaurants etc. We loved the room we had; clean, large bathroom, clean towels. Breakfast was included and we never missed it because it was very good! We were also very satisfied about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: StandardTourist
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean, good location. Staff helpfull, delicious breakfast. I loved my stay in this hotel, I was alone and everything was perfect. Neighbourhood is very nice (seems to be secure), the hotel is in front of a beautiful park. There is a tram stop very close to the hotel, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ieba
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at Sarphati hotel we immediately liked it. The person who welcomed us was very friendly and provided us with useful information. The room was very clean and neat, clean towels every day. Breakfast was absolutely very good. The area in which the hotel is situated is very pleasant, everything is closeby. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Stuey67
Reviews.Content: I pre-booked this hotel online, then paid all on arrival. I just wish I had checked my room first. I was allocated room No 15 (a single). It was uncomfortably small - the toilet, wash-hand basin and shower were all crammed into one tiny room. I complained to the manager, who agreed to allocate me a different room the following day (that night, he said, they were full). But to be honest, the second room wasn't a great deal better. Then there are the stairs. They are very steep and narrow, bordering on the dangerous. One bannister was at first loose, then broken off the wall. What made my five-night stay all the more galling was the fact that it was NOT what I would call cheap for the standard provided: I paid 443 Euros for the 5 nights (that's 87 Euros, or about 53 GBP, per night for just one person). Dreadful value for money. So, my advice is: spend just a bit more and get somewhere decent. But if you must stay here, check your room first. And for solo travellers: don't get landed with room 15!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March following its renovation. It is, as most residential buildings in the area would be, extremely narrow. The bedroom we had was on the top floor and upon our arrival we realised we should have packed a rope to haul ourselves up the tiny and very steep stairs. Obviously not recommeneded for those with a mobility problem. The bedroom was booked as a double room but it was made up of two twin beds pushed together although still with a rather large gap in between. There was very little room to move around the bed or to put luggage but it had clearly been recently decorated in a modern, neutral style and was very clean and tidy. The showerroom was the source of much entertainment. It was wet-room style and the shower was practically over the top of the toilet and the sink, guaranteeing shower gel on your toothbrush and soggy toilet tissue but again the bathroom has new fittings and was cleaned every day. The only minor problem we had was that the sink was blocked and would not drain so it was teeth cleaning and hand washing under the shower for us. The area was not particularly noisy and the hotel was ideally located for the park and one of the markets which are within a couple of minutes wander. It is also directly opposite a tram stop. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the breakfast room was well kept and pleasant with an enjoyable but simple breakfast provided. We were kindly offered the option of breakfast at different times as we had some time constraints. Overall I would be happy to stay here again, we were on a budget and got more than we expected. It is clean, comfortable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: waterwoman2002
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel over the internet. Spent 4 nights there on my own, single Can. woman, enroute to East Africa. Great location, close to the street market and lots of restaurants and pubs. Great access to trolleys/tram. You can be in the centre of the city within 10 minutes, 5 minute walk to the Amsterdam Experience. Price of room includes a great breakfast. Staff/owner friendly and helpful. Thanks to the owner for sharing his red wine with me. Room was adequate, small, but who cares? Bed was comfy, room was clean. I had a room on the top floor. Noise carries so bring your ear plugs. Good value. Great place for those who like to walk and wander. Area felt very safe, lots of people out and about. Avoid walking in the park at night. Cheers Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected but still not good enough”
Reviews.Author: evilash
Reviews.Content: we stayed here just recently and we had a few complaints, firstly the room was tiny, we almost fell over the 'double bed'(2 singles really) when we 1st came in with our suitcases(we had to manouvre the bed just so we could open the suitcase!!, we stayed on the 1st level so thankfully we didnt have to drag our suitcases up the stairs, the main hall/stairs constantly smelled of cigarettes/weed. And also our room didnt have an openable window, the perplex window we did have looked right out to the reception so we at time couldnt open our curtains!!! i spoke to the owner and he said he had just bought the hotel like a week or so before we arrived so i think the service etc we recieved was better than previous guests have recieved, our shower was new and perfect(apparently its the best in the hotel!!!), our bed sheets were changed everyday as was our towels, we didnt even bother with the breakfast but we could practically hear the other guests eating theirs because our room was right above the kitchen/breakfast area. We wont be staying here again and i would suggest you give the new hotel albert management some time to bring the hotel up to par with the rest of the decent 2** hotels in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine small hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: acs44
Reviews.Content: I needed a last minute and inexpensive spot in Amsterdam ---- and the Hotel Albert filled the bill perfectly. True, there's nothing fancy happening here, but the room was simple and clean, the sheets comfy, and the neighborhood was great. Consider breakfast to be just a bit of fuel to get you on your way and you'll be happy. And Amsterdam ---- well, I'm coming back soon!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very firendly lady at check in help alot with our bags good room plenty of hot water of shower nice little platform when you open up the doors in room 12 over all good for the money you pay

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit should be condemded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst accomodation i've ever stayed in anywere in the world. the place should not be allowed to get away with false advertising. the doubleroom had no toilet. the plumbing was disgraceful piped up wrong hot to cold cold to hot. i got scalded having a shower because the shower is not thermastaticly controlled if someone in the hotel starts running the water the shower is affected hence being scalded. the staff were a waste of time and most unhelpful. the towels were never changed just folded and put back on the bed. as for breakfast what break fast, a bit of stale bread 2 pieces of plastic cheese something that looked like spam or salami, i wouldnt give to a pig wot these people tried to serve us. and god help anyone if a fire breaks out no information should a fire occur.

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel! pleasant staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I dont agree with the other reviews, for a two star hotel it was perfectly fine. the staff were all friendly and helpful and gave us lots of info on the city i.e things to see and do, how to get around etc. the rooms were clean, the view was fine, and the area was really nice. although it was more of a tram ride to get to the centre rather than a walk, it is in a lovely area which gives you a real sense of how the locals live. For breakfast we were given a huge basket of different kinds of bread/rolls etc and lots of different things to put on them. There was also orange juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate etc. plenty of hot water and fresh towels everyday.We had no problems with this hotel, nothing to complain about. i thnk the reviews given so far have been unfair, and i think this hotel is fine for a two star. we had a lovely time all round.

Reviews.Title: “To Avoid Absolutely”
Reviews.Author: tgalli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a double room for 4 days based on the web pages and description. This hotel is definitively not to the standar of 2 stars. The room was not clean, the shower not working. All the noises pass from room to room se we were woken up by neighbors going to the bathrooms etc... We were asked to pay all 4 nights immediately upon arrival. The first morning, we asked to check out at 9h30 because we wanted to leave. We were told that the policy was no cancellation no refund. I argued and complained but only the last night was reimbursed. We paid 416 euros and got back 85. The manager would not talk to me and the guy in charge was mean. This is the typical place you book on the internet and find yourself tied to a "contract" never signed. Please go somewhere else; there are so many better places!

Reviews.Title: “Minus two stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We refused to stay despite their policy of charging for one night's stay -- in our case $237.79. The place is a dump, perhaps acceptable to someone with a backpack, but for a family with suitcases the lack of an elevator and the steep winding staircase up several stories was unacceptable. The wallpaper in the room was ripped off and hanging down. The room was totally permeated with cigarette smoke. The proprietor gave us the finger. This is the kind of place that creates problems for people making reservations on the internet. The designation of this place as two stars is absolutely false. This place is of similar quality to an old, old motel on a back road in the US that would cost $17.95 per night. The photographs and advertising for this hotel are absolutely misleading. We walked down the street a short distance to the Hotel Aalborg and received fine accommodations. We also stayed in the fine Hotel Bellvue in Amsterdam. The Hotel Albert is a burn and a ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely unsuggestable... worst possible accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in (we had four rooms 10 pax), this was the worst two star hotel i've ever seen!!! the rooms were so dirty, dust everywhere, old newspapers and tins behind the beds, window could not be opened because it was broken. staff could not have been ruder.... breakfast almost none... as we decided to search another hotel the staff just said no.. and wanted the amount of the entire stay (which is not legal at all, they can charge only the first night) finally we staid our 5 nights paing way too much...for our disgusting rooms and bathrooms and i would never go again. worst accomodation ever... DON'T GO if have the chance to go somewhere else (suggestion by a hotelier)

HotelInfo.Name: Sarphati Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Sarphatipark 58, Amsterdam 1073, The Netherlands (Formerly Hotel Albert)
